column8: Capabilities related to understanding the demographics of customers and potential customers, including segmentation, buying patterns, and marketing relationships. Ability to understand how customers respond to our marketing messages, management of campaigns toward target segments, and responding to customer end-actions. A key differentiator of marketing management from sales is that sales focuses on the "1-on-1" customer interaction, where marketing focuses on market segment-level interaction and statistical methods for analysis, which eventually leads to sales activities.
Multiple external variables (such as economic, political-legal, competitive, technological, socio-cultural and ethical variables) need to be continuously monitored.
Ability to understand the current state market of products and services, as well as trends, new business models.
The study and identification of some characteristic of people in the overall mass market that aids in dividing it.

Evaluate an ad's strategy effectiveness through pre-tests (focus group interviews, consumer juries, projective techniques) and post-tests (readership tests, unaided recalls, inquiry tests), advertising effort response elasticity, split-run tests, sales the

Analyze the state of the market information and how each of the industry players fit in the competition matrix.  Answer questions such as who are the key product service providers, what exactly are they offering, why are Partner Customers choosing that particular
Gathering and analyzing of Partner Customer lifecycle data (identifying Partner Customers' cyclical behaviors and the reasons behind the duration of the relationship).

Evaluation of a product's service's business attractiveness.  Profitability analysis consists of comparing demand analysis (forecasting market and sales potential, and estimating the competitive reaction) to cost analysis (estimating research and develop
The performance evaluation procedure designed to identify areas in which sales channel performance problems and opportunities exist.

Evaluation of a product category's business attractiveness.  Analysis consists of comparing demand analysis (forecasting market and sales potential, and estimating the competitive reaction) to cost analysis (estimating research and development, production
Gathering and analyzing demographics information in order to be able to divide a mass market on the basis of statistical data such as age, sex, and buying power.
Gathering and analyzing of a product's sales history over time, including repeat purchases, not just first time sales.
The analysis of products & services frequently purchased together or in conjunction with one another.
The study of behaviors or tendencies amongst shoppers
Gathering and analyzing of market lifecycle data (identifying a market's cyclical behaviors and the reasons behind the duration of the relationship).

After a campaign has been executed, these are the capabilities that allow for monitoring the efficacy and response of a given campaign. Includes post-campaign analysis and is an input into future campaigns.
Defining the specific target market as the focus for the marketing effort and specifying a marketing mix to satisfy that market are imperative in developing a marketing strategy.

Planning capabilities for mid to long-term marketing activities. Strategic planning capabilities require more than typical current state inputs, but also analytical, "what-if" modeling capabilities with industry trends as inputs.
Determine the appropriate use of resources allocated to advertising.  Involves selecting the proper medium (TV, radio, etc…) to market the product or service.

Ability to define and develop a marketing plan both directly to a specific customer or in collaboration with a partner. This typically requires involvement with those in a Sales capability, as target is toward a specific customer or customer segment, with plans beyond the "End Action" stage of marketing. Partners and Sales personnel are key stakeholders regarding this capability.

Estimate the number of units or the dollar sales volume the enterprise expects to reach for a specific product in a specific market over a specific time period, given an intended level and type of marketing effort by the firm and an expected set of environmental conditions. Differs from Sales Forecasting it that it is based upon macro-level analysis, not individual customers.
After a campaign has been planned and developed, execution and management of the campaign lifecycle.

Capability of developing the marketing campaign, including ensuring that marketing objectives are met and the associated collateral development. Includes segmentation and customer profile analysis as supporting capabilities, along with a response management plan.

Ability to, once the campaign has been executed, of managing the activities of the campaign team, including 3rd party resources. Statusing, resource management, and reporting are all supporting capabilities.
Beyond just the campaign team activities, capabilities that support planning at the entire campaign level.
Determining at which level campaign budgeting is to take place (e.g., cell versus activity level,) allocation at campaign phases, ROI.
Development of the plan for when a targeted customer responds with an end action.

Capabilities limited to the creation of creative marketing collateral execution. Response management planning is still required, but the focus is on increasing the number of impressions to the target segment.
Marketing communications capabilities are those related to both broadcast and targeted communication toward a targeted segment in order to establish initial impressions.
Capabilities related to creation, tracking, versioning of marketing brochures, whitepapers, commercials, and advertising for a given marketing campaign.
Ability to generate emails en mass, as well as more targeted emails, for a given marketing campaign.
Ability to hold virtual conferences via the Internet, including the creation and management of the content to be presented.
Creation of direct-mail brochures, pamphlets.
Development of online ads, banner ads for a given marketing campaign.
Ability to create electronic newsletters, which can also include the ability to subscribe and unsubscribe to specific topics of interests to a prospect.
Ability to fulfill, electronically or physical, collateral and or obligations to a prospect for providing initial PII.
Management of third-party and in-house list of target customers for a given ad campaign. Can include existing customer lists.

Ability for collection and proper routing of all customer data. Key capabilities include monitoring Campaign performance to determine whether to run program as planned, make adjustments, or end early as well as ensuring that customer data is validated and qualified, and routed to appropriate parties based upon response attributes.
Based upon end-user actions of a campaign, the ability to respond to them and take appropriate action, including further qualification and PII retrieval with consent.
Capabilities for capture and management of customer profile information from Campaign respondents. Typically an outcome of an End Action from a prospect.
Ability to, based upon respondent actions, as well as profile data, route the response to the appropriate next step and role.
Monitoring and metrics around the response for a given campaign.

The ability to create, schedule, and execute marketing events for increased awareness, as well as sales lead generation. Includes the ability to schedule events for a target audience, as well as tracking registrations and cancellations.
Capabilities in support of managing a given channel, such as direct, online, or partner.

Process of grouping Partner\Customers, assigning those groups to one or multiple sales representatives channel partners, defining sales goals, and analyzing territory performance.  Territories are usually defined by geography, industry, product line, volume of sales

Process of grouping Partner\Customers and assigning those groups to one or multiple sales representatives.  Territories are usually defined by geography, industry focus, demographics, product line, volume of sales,  named account, etc.
Ability to plan and forecast sales volume expectations set with various territories.  The enterprise communicates sales goals to potential partner and filed sales by territory.
As territories are identified, certified partners who will be responsible for meeting determined negotiated goals are aligned to those territories .
Territory performance is examined to identify major successes, issues, and room for improvement.  This analysis will determine recommended changes to the territory plan moving forward.

Capabilities around managing a telemarketing call center and team, including response routing, representative schedule, effectiveness analysis. Includes preparation and planning, scripting for an outbound Telemarketing Campaign. Covers "cold calling" from lists or callbacks from an End Action.

Capabilities related to alliance and relationship management for channel partners, including OEM, ISV, System Integrators, and Resellers. The capabilities are more unique to partner channels than other channels (direct, retail, online.)
The enterprise creates a profile that represents the ideal partner.    The profile created would include information such as revenue, sales growth rate, expertise, Agreements, location, etc?.

The process of managing public, Partner\Customer facing partner relationships (identifying the desired characteristics of a potential partner, recruiting partners who fit the criteria, certifying and registering those partners, maintaining partner Agreements, and
Through extensive research and interviewing, partners who fit the profile are identified.  Once they are identified, the enterprise conducts a recruiting effort to establish relations.
The ability to establish and track specific royalty agreements based upon specific products and services used within each others' products. Includes the ability to calculate royalties, tracking.
Ability to collaboratively define a plan with channel partners in selling and deploying their solutions involving company products.

Detailed  partnership plans are drafted, communicated, combined, and shared between the partner and the enterprise to facilitate joint selling. Defining shared business plans, common objectives, strategies, and targets a part of this capability.
Joint Microsoft-Partner effort to define and develop Through-Partner and With-Partner marketing campaigns.

Ability to monitor the sales force performance as per sales objectives, as well as tracking new business development by the sales force.

A Quote is an offer by one Party to sell goods or services at specific prices to another Party within a given period of time.

A pro forma invoice (a.k.a. quote) is generated and sent to the customer showing information such as product(s))))) ordered, quantity, ship date, price, ship to and bill to information, shipping mode, payment terms, etc.. In order to allow the customer to
Optional step.
Full lifecycle of receiving an order and managing it's completion through to product provisioning

Order management enters the customer orders into an order entry form where appropriate pricing lists, products, and delivery schedules are applied and validated. This includes the potential setup of complex parent-child account hierarchies and the entry o

Availability checks can be performed to reply to customer or enterprise inquiries.  When an order is placed, the order configuration will perform an existing inventory availability check before allocating a particular product to that order.
To enter an order, the order Configurator guides user through a validation tree.  When building order in product Configurator, quotes are validated real-time and errors are kept at a minimum.
Based on the Partner\Customer's requirements, the appropriate shipping mode (LTL, LCL, CAN) is selected for delivery of the ordered product.

If a Partner\Customer orders a product that is currently out of stock, no longer offered, was never offered, has long lead times, or is a product of lesser quality, order management is prepared to offer order recommendations that would meet the Partner\Customer's require
Appropriate country specific statutory taxes are applied to the Partner\Customer's order or must be self assessed, depending on country and taxing model.

Apply any additional price discounts that accrue, such as resulting from organizations fulfilling their commitments to buy large quantities, good will gestures, and or mutually agreed upon Partner\Customer specific discounts given.

The process of initiating the validation of the form of payment based on established credit policies and on-account information.  Payment methods are country and or currency specific.  These include credit card, invoice, EFT, direct debit, debit cards, wi
Once the  product has been ordered and payment received, the purchase is complete and a receipt or payment acknowledgement can be generated for the Partner\Customer for recording purposes.

Once the order has been entered and is in process, Partner\Customer or sales rep may inquire about order status.  Sales order management allows status checks on an order to address questions like: is the order on schedule, where is it on the manufacturing line, c

If a Partner\Customer finds that the product they purchased is unsatisfactory or defective, the enterprise may allow the Partner\Customer to return exchange the product.  In this situation, the enterprise needs to make adjustments to their inventory levels to reflect the

To stimulate demand, promotional coupons in circulation will be accepted and processed, resulting in price discounts and or other order management configurations.  Both human and automated resources should be prepared to handle the promotion.

Predefined scheduling agreements can be setup to provide constant product replenishment.  These automatic replenishment programs often are associated with "open to buy" or "blanket PO" order arrangements, with guaranteed replenishment schedules.
Account representative tracks replenishment performance compliance and updates the scheduling agreement whenever the Partner\Customer notifies them of any changes.

The process of adding or associating any service related elements of an order.  For example, an order may consist of a product plus the servicing of that product.  These orders must reflect both the physical fulfillment of a product and the Agreement terms

In addition to taxes, some products ordered require further statutory reporting depending on type of good service and country.  Examples include intercompany commerce reporting or hazardous materials shipments.

Tracking the liability of unearned revenue (services owed for payment received)
Ability to retrieve historical billing information including settlement amounts, settlement dates, payment status, payment information, payment terms, etc.
Make appropriate accounting adjustments for items a customer chooses not to make payment for due to returns, charge backs, insufficient funds, or some type of customer dispute.
The issuance of a debit or credit to an account for miscellaneous reasons (i.e. overcharge, good-will)
The costs related to accounts receivable are allocated to organization business units.  Such costs might include bad debt write offs, collections, charge backs and other bank related charges.

Process around setting up and maintaining Partner\Customer account hierarchies and rollup groups, such as in the case of Partner\Customer with multiple payment preferences, multiple locations, or multiple legal entities.

The conditions of sale proposed by a vendor, generally stated on the invoice or agreed upon prior to sale between buyer and vendor. The terms usually include payment due date, discount amount or percentage (if any), and discount due date.

Restating the value of receivables on the balance sheet.  This is usually done in a high inflation economy where the value of the asset fluctuates as a result of increases decreases in the value of the currency.
Capability to manage payments owed to suppliers & vendors
Capability for receiving, verifying validity, and entering invoice into payments systems.  Invoices can be received in a variety of methods (fax, EDI, snail mail, internally).
Involves verifying that the quantity being invoiced, matches the same quantity that was ordered and received.
Ability manually or automatically generating payments against invoices (either internal or external)
Capability for  identifying what invoices are to be paid, when the payment is carried out, who is to be paid, how the payment is made, and where the payment is made from (location).

Capability for printing, signing, and sending payment for services or products rendered via paper and manual means.  Once a payment has been remitted, the A P department must reconcile the account to ensure the transaction completed accurately.
Involves the approval process and sending of  electronic payment transfers, such as EFT (as opposed to printing checks)
Capability for monitoring expenditure limits and preventing a department or area from ordering or paying for goods or services beyond the predefined limits.  Generally found in Government accounting.

Capability for monitoring tax statutory compliance.  Payables will typically be   responsible for producing the requisite government supporting documentation (varies by country) and submitting tax payments on a defined basis (monthly, quarterly
Capability calculating and paying the tax assessed to produce and sell  business goods and services.
Employee expenses are distributed to appropriate cost centers based on expense reports submitted for reimbursement.
Capability around debit credit washing between partners, customers, employee accounts receivable, accounts payable, payroll, etc..
Capability around setting up and maintaining vendor account hierarchies and rollup groups, such as in the case of multi-payment options, multiple locations, or companies.

Capability for analysis showing how long accounts payable have been outstanding. It usually shows the percentage of payables which are not past due and the percentages past due by various time intervals.

Restating the value of liabilities on the balance sheet.  This is usually done in a high inflation economy where the value of the asset fluctuates as a result of increases decreases in the value of the currency.
Involves tracking Vendor Supplier Agreements and ensuring the organization is fulfilling  its payment obligations per the scope of the Agreement.

column2: 6.13 Manage Credit Card & Electronic Funds Processing
column8: Capability to manage and process electronic funds including electronic transaction types as well as their authorization and authentication

Request made to a financial clearinghouse which verifies that the account is in the current format and is in good standing (usually a real-time operation). Authorization processes an amount for future settlement (specified amount is removed from accounts
Requests made to financial clearinghouses for subsequent settlement against a specific account (usually a batch operation).

Capability by which accounts who have failed settlements are identified.  Corrective action like reprocessing or write-offs are determined based off such factors as # of declines and decline type (soft decline vs. hard decline)
Capability by which a refund is processed back to the account through a financial clearinghouse - either account initiated (cancellation) or system initiated (overcharge).
Capability for approving and releasing payments to customers in the form of electronic funds.

Ability to manage the regular payment of salary to employees and managing various deductions for tax, stock purchase, benefits etc. Also includes the management of bank account information related to pay roll
Capabilities related to planning, managing and running the Human Resources operations in an enterprise.

The capability to define what talents are required, when they are required and how many are required. Also includes succession planning. Workforce planning includes capabilities that sets up the rhythm for gathering current plans from business units that allows comparison of workforce growth with financial headcount constraints, critical talent segments (pivotal roles) and the availability of critical talent in the market. Workforce planning also includes the assessment of apparent gaps in diversity hiring practices
Assess current alignment of business strategy to human capital performance results, and define the future vision and implementation plan of leadership, workforce, and culture
The model that forms the basis for employees to assess, plan and execute on career goals
Capabilities such as employee feedback through surveys, peer organization assessment etc to assess how well the organization is functioning
Capabilities such as employee feedback through surveys, peer organization assessment etc to assess how well the organization is functioning
Capability to assess and influence the culture of organization

Staffing vision and goal setting are capabilities required to synchronize with financial planning and strategic planning initiatives to include constraints and strategic imperatives to setup optimal scenarios for workforce growth. Staffing plans received from business units are consolidated and compared with other planning results.
Based on strategy and environment

column8: Capabilities to define and setup foundational components like roles, jobs, competencies, organizational hierarchies and reporting relationships to enable workforce planning. Also includes capabilities to define workforce dimensions (business, region, profession, level)

Analysis for identifying Critical Skill gaps and resource utilization analysis such as quality of hires and other workforce optimization analysis based on resource utilization, quota attainment and other quantitative productivity measures by person. Also includes analysis of requisitions as part of assessment of likely achievement of workforce plans
Workforce location & housing plans
Define shifts and schedules for workforce

Includes administrative functions to support workforce planning. This capability ensures Workforce Plans reflect reality in major US countries; Provide joint HR finance workforce view to HRLT and FLT; Provide joint HR finance workforce view to HRLT and FLT; Connect with gap analysis for partner+ positions; Supplement workforce plans with internal activity estimates

The business capabilities needed to fulfill l the staffing needs of the organization based on the workforce plans. This includes creating job postings, advertising, searching for candidates, interviewing, selecting of Full time employees, contingent staff and interns. On-boarding includes capabilities required to on-board new hires as well as employees transitioning to a new role.

Identifying sources for the right set of internal external candidates for fulfilling the workforce requirements. Strategy to define where and how candidates will be solicited from. Includes sourcing strategies such as mobilizing employee referral program, pursuing candidate leads, ability to attract top talent

Includes program management and design and creation of content for on-boarding and gathering and analyzing the feedback from the on-boarding program

Identifying and prepare qualifying employees through mentoring, training and job rotation, to success key players (i.e. top level management) in the organization when their terms end
